related_questions.question: What was the age of Keturah when she married Abraham?
related_questions.snippet: Keturah was one and the same as Hagar. In Genesis 21:1, we learn that Abraham remarried three years after the death of Sarah. Once his son Isaac was married off, Abraham, at age 140, married Keturah, who bore him six children.
related_questions.title: How old was Keturah when she got married to Abraham?

related_questions.question: Why did Abraham marry Keturah?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Fulfilling Promises: The Bible emphasizes God's promise to Abraham that he would be the father of many nations. Keturah's sons, who are associated with Arabian tribes, can be seen as part of fulfilling this promise.
Connecting Lineages: By marrying Keturah, Abraham's lineage is connected to these tribes, which is significant in understanding the relationships between different groups in the region.

Alternative Perspective: Some interpretations, particularly within Jewish tradition, identify Keturah with Hagar, Abraham's former concubine. This perspective suggests that Hagar returned to Abraham after Sarah's death, and they had more children.
Symbolic Significance: Some scholars interpret Keturah's name, which is linked to incense, as symbolic of the aromatic spices traded by the tribes descended from her.
Contrast with Sarah: The inclusion of Keturah and her children also highlights the special status of Sarah and Isaac, as they are the ones through whom the covenant with God is continued.
End of an Era: Abraham's marriage to Keturah is often seen as the final chapter in his life, following the death of Sarah and the marriage of Isaac.

related_questions.question: How many children did Abraham have from Keturah?
related_questions.snippet: Keturah bore Abraham six sons: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. Genesis and First Chronicles also list seven of her grandsons (Sheba, Dedan, Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah).
related_questions.title: six sons

text_blocks.snippet: Abraham was likely around 140 years old when he married Keturah. This is based on the biblical account placing his marriage to Keturah after Sarah's death and Isaac's marriage. Sarah died at age 127, and Abraham was 100 when Isaac was born. Isaac married at age 40. Since Abraham lived to be 175, this means he would have been around 140 when he married Keturah.
